content.description: Match on the slopey hold all the way on the right which pretty much touches the tree.  Used a foot jam to stop my legs from dabbing onto the tree.

The start is a match on a slopey jug, to the left of the "There" grafitti.  The holds are all V2, but the proximity of the ground makes the foot placement require some core strength or funsized stature.
content.location: Continue parallel to the trail from Compromise.  The boulder on which this problem is located is short but wide.

content.description: Starts on the right side: lefthand on a sidepull crimp and right hand on a shallow crack around the arete.  Super slopey the whole way up.
content.protection: 1 pad. Watch out for the fallen tree.
content.location: From the Bonnie Way entrance, take the righthand path that follows the creek.  The boulder is 1-2 minutes away (among the boulders closest to the entrance), and can be seen from the trail.  Cross the creek to get to it.

content.description: Start by matching the slopey crimp on the left side.
content.protection: 1 pad. Watch out for the fallen tree

content.description: Start all the way left, inside the filthy crack; top out at the junction formed by the two rocks.
content.protection: 1 pad, mainly to save your ass bones

content.description: Sit start on the left arete. Any holds smaller than a jug may crumble to dust.
content.location: Continue on the trail from Shichibukai.  This is part of the next group of boulders; can be found on the same side of the creek as the trail.

content.description: Start at the left side, at the bottom of the hold where it seems a rectangular chunk fell off
content.location: From the Bonnie Way entrance, walk on the righthand trail for ~5 minutes. Due to a swampy area, eventually there will be a fork in the path: take the left route.  The boulder can be seen on the right, just prior to a small bridge over the creek.

content.description: Scattered metamorphic/igneous boulders along the trail
